short_desc: Primary medical care, including podiatry, chronic disease management, dementia care and psychosocial services
description: Offers primary medical care for adults age 21 or over. Services include screening and evaluations, preventive health services, podiatry (foot) care, and referrals for specialty care. Specialty areas include chronic disease management and treatment of Alzheimer's Disease and other dementias. Psychosocial services, including assessments, home visits, psychotherapy and chemical dependency assessment, are also available. Preventive services include nutrition counseling, weight management and smoking cessation and education programs. Target group includes adult geriatric patients with complex needs, and uninsured persons age 55 and over.
